1.The bearer of the banknote is supposed to compare the suspected banknote with one of the same denomination from a different source. 


 2. Do not compare with the reproductions in a brochure (or a print out from the internet), which always differ from the original. 


 3. Unfold a received banknote and look at the front and the back. 


 4. Check the banknote for the security features (refer to write-up on the Features of the Ghanaian Banknote) 


 5. Pay attention to soiled or repaired bills 


 6. The Bank of Ghana can assist you in verifying the validity of a suspected note. 


 7. Notify the police as soon as possible if you think that a banknote has been counterfeited
